    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>os version:<span class="line"><!---->os version:<!----></span><br>ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br>chrome version:<span class="line"><!---->chrome version:<!----></span><br>Chromium 107.0.5300.0<span class="line"><!---->Chromium 107.0.5300.0<!----></span><br>Chromium 108.0.5307.0<span class="line"><!---->Chromium 108.0.5307.0<!----></span><br><br>1. download asan version <span class="line"><!---->1. download asan version <!----></span><br>gsutil cp   gs://chromium-browser-asan/linux-release/asan-linux-release-asan-linux-release-1048423.zip .<span class="line"><!---->gsutil cp   gs://chromium-browser-asan/linux-release/asan-linux-release-asan-linux-release-1048423.zip .<!----></span><br>or build custom version:<span class="line"><!---->or build custom version:<!----></span><br>args.gn:<span class="line"><!---->args.gn:<!----></span><br>is_asan = true<span class="line"><!---->is_asan = true<!----></span><br>is_debug = false<span class="line"><!---->is_debug = false<!----></span><br>enable_nacl = false<span class="line"><!---->enable_nacl = false<!----></span><br>treat_warnings_as_errors = false<span class="line"><!---->treat_warnings_as_errors = false<!----></span><br>is_component_build=false<span class="line"><!---->is_component_build=false<!----></span><br>dcheck_always_on = false<span class="line"><!---->dcheck_always_on = false<!----></span><br><br>2. ./chrome <span class="line"><!---->2. ./chrome <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a><br><br>3. enter ctrl+shit+i to open developer tools page<span class="line"><!---->3. enter ctrl+shit+i to open developer tools page<!----></span><br><br>4. The page will crash immediately, if it doesn't crash, manually click [Table] in the console tab<span class="line"><!---->4.         Can repro, and agree with the culprit CL. The code around <span class="line"><!---->Can repro, and agree with the culprit CL. The code around <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3852485/9/src/debug/debug-wasm-objects.cc#1042<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3852485/9/src/debug/debug-wasm-objects.cc#1042"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3852485/9/src/debug/debug-wasm-objects.cc#1042<!----></a> doesn't work for tables created in JS via `new WebAssembly.Table(...)`.<span class="line"><!----> doesn't work for tables created in JS via `new WebAssembly.Table(...)`.<!----></span><br><br>Here's a unit test to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Here's a unit test to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br><br>diff --git a/test/unittests/runtime/runtime-debug-unittest.cc b/test/unittests/runtime/runtime-debug-unittest.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/test/unittests/runtime/runtime-debug-unittest.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@<span class="line"><!---->@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@<!----></span><br> #include "include/v8-object.h"<span class="line"><!----> #include "include/v8-object.h"<!----></span><br> #include "include/v8-template.h"<span class="line"><!----> #include "include/v8-template.h"<!----></span><br> #include "src/api/api.h"<span class="line"><!----> #include "src/api/api.h"<!----></span><br>+#include "src/objects/js-array-inl.h"<span class="line"><!---->+#include "src/objects/js-array-inl.h"<!----></span><br> #include "src/objects/objects-inl.h"<span class="line"><!----> #include "src/objects/objects-inl.h"<!----></span><br> #include "src/runtime/runtime.h"<span class="line"><!----> #include "src/runtime/runtime.h"<!----></span><br> #include "test/unittests/test-utils.h"<span class="line"><!----> #include "test/unittests/test-utils.h"<!----></span><br>@@ -56,6 +57,22 @@ TEST_F(RuntimeTest, DoesNotReturnPrototypeWhenInacessible) {<span class="line"><!---->@@ -56,6 +57,22 @@ TEST_F(RuntimeTest, DoesNotReturnPrototypeWhenInacessible) {<!----></span><br>   EXPECT_EQ(0u, result->Length());<span class="line"><!---->   EXPECT_EQ(0u, result-&gt;Length());<!----></span><br> }<span class="line"><!----> }<!----></span><br><br>+#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY<span class="line"><!---->+#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY<!----></span><br>+TEST_F(RuntimeTest, WasmTableWithoutInstance) {<span class="line"><!---->+TEST_F(RuntimeTest, WasmTableWithoutInstance) {<!----></span><br>+  uint32_t initial = 1u;<span class="line"><!---->+  uint32_t initial = 1u;<!----></span><br>+  bool has_maximum = false;<span class="line"><!---->+  bool has_maximum = false;<!----></span><br>+  uint32_t maximum = std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max();<span class="line"><!---->+  uint32_t maximum = std::numeric_limits&lt;uint32_t&gt;::max();<!----></span><br>+  Handle<FixedArray> elements;<span class="line"><!---->+  Handle&lt;FixedArray&gt; elements;<!----></span><br>+  Handle<WasmTableObject> table = WasmTableObject::New(<span class="line"><!---->+  Handle&lt;WasmTableObject&gt; table = WasmTableObject::New(<!----></span><br>+      i_isolate(), Handle<WasmInstanceObject>(), wasm::kWasmAnyRef, initial,<span class="line"><!---->+      i_isolate(), Handle&lt;WasmInstanceObject&gt;(), wasm::kWasmAnyRef, initial,<!----></span><br>+      has_maximum, maximum, &elements, i_isolate()->factory()->null_value());<span class="line"><!---->+      has_maximum, maximum, &amp;elements, i_isolate()-&gt;factory()-&gt;null_value());<!----></span><br>+  MaybeHandle<JSArray> result =<span class="line"><!---->+  MaybeHandle&lt;JSArray&gt; result =<!----></span><br>+      Runtime::GetInternalProperties(i_isolate(), table);<span class="line"><!---->+      Runtime::GetInternalProperties(i_isolate(), table);<!----></span><br>+  EXPECT_FALSE(result.is_null());<span class="line"><!---->+  EXPECT_FALSE(result.is_null());<!----></span><br>+  EXPECT_EQ(1, result.ToHandleChecked()->elements().length());<span class="line"><!---->+  EXPECT_EQ(1, result.ToHandleChecked()-&gt;elements().length());<!----></span><br>+}<span class="line"><!---->+}<!----></span><br>+#endif<span class="line"><!---->+#endif<!----></span><br>+<span class="line"><!---->+<!----></span><br> }  // namespace<span class="line"><!----> }  // namespace<!----></span><br> }  // namespace internal<span class="line"><!----> }  // namespace internal<!----></span><br> }  // namespace v8<span class="line"><!----> }  // namespace         by

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>

          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam FoundIn-107 Type-Bug-Regression

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam FoundIn-107 Type-Bug-Regression
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I believe this is not a security bug: we're erroneously reading a field out of the `undefined` sentinel and reinterpret that as a pointer (which crashes on the next step because it isn't a valid pointer), so the crashing address is not attacker-controlled. So I don't think this is exploitable, I think it'll always just crash. Besides, it needs user interaction (opening DevTools and inspecting something).<span class="line"><!---->I believe this is not a security bug: we're erroneously reading a field out of the `undefined` sentinel and reinterpret that as a pointer (which crashes on the next step because it isn't a valid pointer), so the crashing address is not attacker-controlled. So I don't think this is exploitable, I think it'll always just crash. Besides, it needs user interaction (opening DevTools and inspecting something).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

        }

      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>os version:<span class="line"><!---->os version:<!----></span><br>ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br>chrome version:<span class="line"><!---->chrome version:<!----></span><br>Chromium 107.0.5300.0<span class="line"><!---->Chromium 107.0.5300.0<!----></span><br>Chromium 108.0.5307.0<span class="line"><!---->Chromium 108.0.5307.0<!----></span><br><br>1. download asan version <span class="line"><!---->1. download asan version <!----></span><br>gsutil cp   gs://chromium-browser-asan/linux-release/asan-linux-release-asan-linux-release-1048423.zip .<span class="line"><!---->gsutil cp   gs://chromium-browser-asan/linux-release/asan-linux-release-asan-linux-release-1048423.zip .<!----></span><br>or build custom version:<span class="line"><!---->or build custom version:<!----></span><br>args.gn:<span class="line"><!---->args.gn:<!----></span><br>is_asan = true<span class="line"><!---->is_asan = true<!----></span><br>is_debug = false<span class="line"><!---->is_debug = false<!----></span><br>enable_nacl = false<span class="line"><!---->enable_nacl = false<!----></span><br>treat_warnings_as_errors = false<span class="line"><!---->treat_warnings_as_errors = false<!----></span><br>is_component_build=false<span class="line"><!---->is_component_build=false<!----></span><br>dcheck_always_on = false<span class="line"><!---->dcheck_always_on = false<!----></span><br><br>2. ./chrome <span class="line"><!---->2. ./chrome <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a><br><br>3. enter ctrl+shit+i to open developer tools page<span class="line"><!---->3. enter ctrl+shit+i to open developer tools page<!----></span><br><br>4. The page will crash immediately, if it doesn't crash, manually click [Table] in the console tab<span class="line"><!---->4. The page will crash immediately, if it doesn't crash, manually click [Table] in the console tab<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>I think this change(<span class="line"><!---->I think this change(<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3852485<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3852485"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3852485<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> is related to this problem.<span class="line"><!----> is related to this problem.<!----></span><br>Received signal 11 SEGV_ACCERR 7d8bfff8000a<span class="line"><!---->Received signal 11 SEGV_ACCERR 7d8bfff8000a<!----></span><br>    #0 0x559503a014cb in backtrace /b/s/w/ir/cache/builder/src/third_party/llvm/compiler-rt/lib/asan/../sanitizer_common/sanitizer_common_interceptors.inc:4434:13<span class="line"><!---->    #0 0x559503a014cb in backtrace /b/s/w/ir/cache/builder/src/third_party/llvm/compiler-rt/lib/asan/../sanitizer_common/sanitizer_common_interceptors.inc:4434:13<!----></span><br>    #1 0x7f384192194c in base::debug::CollectStackTrace(void**, unsigned long) ./../../base/debug/stack_trace_posix.cc:879:7<span class="line"><!---->    #1 0x7f384192194c in base::debug::CollectStackTrace(void**, unsigned long) ./../../base/debug/stack_trace_posix.cc:879:7<!----></span><br>    #2 0x7f38415f7b82 in StackTrace ./../../base/debug/stack_trace.cc:221:12<span class="line"><!---->    #2 0x7f38415f7b82 in StackTrace ./../../base/debug/stack_trace.cc:221:12<!----></span><br>    #3 0x7f38415f7b82 in base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace() ./../../base/debug/stack_trace.cc:218:28<span class="line"><!---->    #3 0x7f38415f7b82 in base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace() ./../../base/debug/stack_trace.cc:218:28<!----></span><br>    #4 0x7f38419202a6 in base::debug::(anonymous namespace)::StackDumpSignalHandler(int, siginfo_t*, void*) ./../../base/debug/stack_trace_posix.cc:372:3<span class="line"><!---->    #4 0x7f38419202a6 in       <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1365101#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Sep 22, 2022, 9:15 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam FoundIn-107 Type-Bug-Regression
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam FoundIn-107 Type-Bug-Regression
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I believe this is not a security bug: we're erroneously reading a field out of the `undefined` sentinel and reinterpret that as a pointer (which crashes on the next step because it isn't a valid pointer), so the crashing address is not attacker-controlled. So I don't think this is exploitable, I think it'll always just crash. Besides, it needs user interaction (opening DevTools and inspecting something).<span class="line"><!---->I believe this is not a security bug: we're erroneously reading a field out of the `undefined` sentinel and reinterpret that as a pointer (which crashes on the next step because it isn't a valid pointer), so the crashing address is not attacker-controlled. So I don't think this is exploitable, I think it'll always just crash. Besides, it needs user interaction (opening DevTools and inspecting something).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        for LitElement.

        <slot></slot>
      </label>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>os version:<span class="line"><!---->os version:<!----></span><br>ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br>chrome version:<span class="line"><!---->chrome version:<!----></span><br>Chromium 107.0.5300.0<span class="line"><!---->Chromium 107.0.5300.0<!----></span><br>Chromium 108.0.5307.0<span class="line"><!---->Chromium 108.0.5307.0<!----></span><br><br>1. download asan version <span class="line"><!---->1. download asan version <!----></span><br>gsutil cp   gs://chromium-browser-asan/linux-release/asan-linux-release-asan-linux-release-1048423.zip .<span class="line"><!---->gsutil cp   gs://chromium-browser-asan/linux-release/asan-linux-release-asan-linux-release-1048423.zip .<!----></span><br>or build custom version:<span class="line"><!---->or build custom version:<!----></span><br>args.gn:<span class="line"><!---->args.gn:<!----></span><br>is_asan = true<span class="line"><!---->is_asan = true<!----></span><br>is_debug = false<span class="line"><!---->is_debug = false<!----></span><br>enable_nacl = false<span class="line"><!---->enable_nacl = false<!----></span><br>treat_warnings_as_errors = false<span class="line"><!---->treat_warnings_as_errors = false<!----></span><br>is_component_build=false<span class="line"><!---->is_component_build=false<!----></span><br>dcheck_always_on = false<span class="line"><!---->dcheck_always_on = false<!----></span><br><br>2. ./chrome <span class="line"><!---->2. ./chrome <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a><br><br>3. enter ctrl+shit+i to open developer tools page<span class="line"><!---->3. enter ctrl+shit+i to open developer tools page<!----></span><br><br>4. The page will crash immediately, if it doesn't crash, manually click [Table] in the console tab<span class="line"><!---->4. The page will crash immediately, if it doesn't crash, manually click [Table] in the console tab<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>I this problem.<span class="line"><!----> is related to this problem.<!----></span><br>Received signal 11 SEGV_ACCERR 7d8bfff8000a<span class="line"><!---->Received signal 11 SEGV_ACCERR doesn't work for tables created in JS via `new WebAssembly.Table(...)`.<span class="line"><!----> doesn't work for tables created in JS via `new WebAssembly.Table(...)`.<!----></span><br><br>Here's a         Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <span class="line"><!---->) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you!           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1365101#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Sep 22, 2022, 9:15 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam FoundIn-107 Type-Bug-Regression
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam FoundIn-107 Type-Bug-Regression
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I believe this is not a security bug: we're erroneously reading a field out of the `undefined` sentinel and reinterpret that as a pointer (which crashes on the next step because it isn't a valid pointer), so the crashing address is not attacker-controlled. So I don't think this is exploitable, I think it'll always just crash. Besides, it needs user interaction (opening DevTools and inspecting something).<span class="line"><!---->I believe this is not a security bug: we're erroneously reading a field out of the `undefined` sentinel and reinterpret that as a pointer (which crashes on the next step because it isn't a valid pointer), so the crashing address is not attacker-controlled. So I don't think this is exploitable, I think it'll always just crash. Besides, it needs user interaction (opening DevTools and inspecting something).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>os version:<span class="line"><!---->os version:<!----></span><br>ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br>chrome version:<span class="line"><!---->chrome version:<!----></span><br>Chromium 107.0.5300.0<span class="line"><!---->Chromium 107.0.5300.0<!----></span><br>Chromium 108.0.5307.0<span class="line"><!---->Chromium 108.0.5307.0<!----></span><br><br>1. download asan version <span class="line"><!---->1. download asan version <!----></span><br>gsutil cp   gs://chromium-browser-asan/linux-release/asan-linux-release-asan-linux-release-1048423.zip .<span class="line"><!---->gsutil cp   gs://chromium-browser-asan/linux-release/asan-linux-release-asan-linux-release-1048423.zip .<!----></span><br>or build custom version:<span class="line"><!---->or build custom version:<!----></span><br>args.gn:<span class="line"><!---->args.gn:<!----></span><br>is_asan = true<span class="line"><!---->is_asan = true<!----></span><br>is_debug = false<span class="line"><!---->is_debug = false<!----></span><br>enable_nacl = false<span class="line"><!---->enable_nacl = false<!----></span><br>treat_warnings_as_errors = false<span class="line"><!---->treat_warnings_as_errors = false<!----></span><br>is_component_build=false<span class="line"><!---->is_component_build=false<!----></span><br>dcheck_always_on = false<span class="line"><!---->dcheck_always_on = false<!----></span><br><br>2. ./chrome <span class="line"><!---->2. ./chrome <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a><br><br>3. enter ctrl+shit+i to open developer tools page<span class="line"><!---->3. enter ctrl+shit+i to open developer tools page<!----></span><br><br>4. The page will crash immediately, if it doesn't crash, manually click [Table] in the console tab<span class="line"><!---->4. The page will crash immediately, if it doesn't crash, manually click [Table] in the console tab<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>I         by

        Can repro, and agree with the culprit CL. The code around <span class="line"><!---->Can repro, and agree with the culprit CL. The code around <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3852485/9/src/debug/debug-wasm-objects.cc#1042<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3852485/9/src/debug/debug-wasm-objects.cc#1042"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3852485/9/src/debug/debug-wasm-objects.cc#1042<!----></a> doesn't work for tables created in JS via `new WebAssembly.Table(...)`.<span class="line"><!----> doesn't work for tables created in JS via `new WebAssembly.Table(...)`.<!----></span><br><br>Here's a unit test to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Here's a unit test to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br><br>diff --git a/test/unittests/runtime/runtime-debug-unittest.cc b/test/unittests/runtime/runtime-debug-unittest.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/test/unittests/runtime/runtime-debug-unittest.cc b/test/unittests/runtime/runtime-debug-unittest.cc<!----></span><br>index a73795bb40..f62674d187 100644<span class="line"><!---->index a73795bb40..f62674d187 100644<!----></span><br>---           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1365101#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Sep 22, 2022, 9:15 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam FoundIn-107 Type-Bug-Regression
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam FoundIn-107 Type-Bug-Regression
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I believe this is not a security bug: we're erroneously reading a field out of the `undefined` sentinel and reinterpret that as a pointer (which crashes on the next step because it isn't a valid pointer), so the crashing address is not attacker-controlled. So I don't think this is exploitable, I think it'll always just crash. Besides, it needs user interaction (opening DevTools and inspecting something).<span class="line"><!---->I believe this is not a security bug: we're erroneously reading a field out of the `undefined` sentinel and reinterpret that as a pointer (which crashes on the next step because it isn't a valid pointer), so the crashing address is not attacker-controlled. So I don't think this is exploitable, I think it'll always just crash. Besides, it needs user interaction (opening DevTools and inspecting something).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);

          display: flex;

        }

        Can repro, and agree with the culprit CL. The code around <span class="line"><!---->Can repro, and agree with the culprit CL. The code around <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3852485/9/src/debug/debug-wasm-objects.cc#1042<a class="undefined" target="_blank" doesn't work for tables created in JS via `new WebAssembly.Table(...)`.<span class="line"><!----> doesn't work for tables created in JS via `new WebAssembly.Table(...)`.<!----></span><br><br>Here's a unit test to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Here's a unit test to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br><br>diff --git a/test/unittests/runtime/runtime-debug-unittest.cc         Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <span class="line"><!---->) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you!         by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam FoundIn-107 Type-Bug-Regression
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam FoundIn-107 Type-Bug-Regression
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I believe this is not a security bug: we're erroneously reading a field out of the `undefined` sentinel and reinterpret that as a pointer (which crashes on the next step because it isn't a valid pointer), so the crashing address is not attacker-controlled. So I don't think this is exploitable, I think it'll always just crash. Besides, it needs user interaction (opening DevTools and inspecting something).<span class="line"><!---->I believe this is not a security bug: we're erroneously reading a field out of the `undefined` sentinel and reinterpret that as a pointer (which crashes on the next step because it isn't a valid pointer), so the crashing address is not attacker-controlled. So I don't think this is exploitable, I think it'll always just crash. Besides, it needs user interaction (opening DevTools and inspecting something).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Description #1 by emily...@gmail.com (Sep 18, 2022)

        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">

          Comment 3<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1365101#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by

        Can repro, and agree with the culprit CL. The code around <span class="line"><!---->Can repro, and agree with the culprit CL. The code around <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3852485/9/src/debug/debug-wasm-objects.cc#1042<a class="undefined" target="_blank" doesn't work for tables created in JS via `new WebAssembly.Table(...)`.<span class="line"><!----> doesn't work for tables created in JS via `new WebAssembly.Table(...)`.<!----></span><br><br>Here's a unit test to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Here's a unit test to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br><br>diff --git a/test/unittests/runtime/runtime-debug-unittest.cc         Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes).           Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam FoundIn-107 Type-Bug-Regression
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam FoundIn-107 Type-Bug-Regression
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I believe this is not a security bug: we're erroneously reading a field out of the `undefined` sentinel and reinterpret that as a pointer (which crashes on the next step because it isn't a valid pointer), so the crashing address is not attacker-controlled. So I don't think this is exploitable, I think it'll always just crash. Besides, it needs user interaction (opening DevTools and inspecting something).<span class="line"><!---->I believe this is not a security bug: we're erroneously reading a field out of the `undefined` sentinel and reinterpret that as a pointer (which crashes on the next step because it isn't a valid pointer), so the crashing address is not attacker-controlled. So I don't think this is exploitable, I think it'll always just crash. Besides, it needs user interaction (opening DevTools and inspecting something).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>os version:<span class="line"><!---->os version:<!----></span><br>ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br>chrome version:<span class="line"><!---->chrome version:<!----></span><br>Chromium 107.0.5300.0<span class="line"><!---->Chromium 107.0.5300.0<!----></span><br>Chromium 108.0.5307.0<span class="line"><!---->Chromium 108.0.5307.0<!----></span><br><br>1. download asan version <span class="line"><!---->1. download asan version <!----></span><br>gsutil cp   gs://chromium-browser-asan/linux-release/asan-linux-release-asan-linux-release-1048423.zip .<span class="line"><!---->gsutil cp   gs://chromium-browser-asan/linux-release/asan-linux-release-asan-linux-release-1048423.zip .<!----></span><br>or build custom version:<span class="line"><!---->or build custom version:<!----></span><br>args.gn:<span class="line"><!---->args.gn:<!----></span><br>is_asan = true<span class="line"><!---->is_asan = true<!----></span><br>is_debug = false<span class="line"><!---->is_debug = false<!----></span><br>enable_nacl = false<span class="line"><!---->enable_nacl = false<!----></span><br>treat_warnings_as_errors = false<span class="line"><!---->treat_warnings_as_errors = false<!----></span><br>is_component_build=false<span class="line"><!---->is_component_build=false<!----></span><br>dcheck_always_on = false<span class="line"><!---->dcheck_always_on = false<!----></span><br><br>2. ./chrome <span class="line"><!---->2. ./chrome <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a><br><br>3. enter ctrl+shit+i to open developer tools page<span class="line"><!---->3. enter ctrl+shit+i to open developer tools page<!----></span><br><br>4. The page will crash immediately, if it doesn't crash, manually click [Table] in the console tab<span class="line"><!---->4. The page will crash immediately, if it doesn't crash, manually click [Table] in the console tab<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>I think this change(<span class="line"><!---->I think this change(<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3852485<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3852485"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3852485<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> is related to this problem.<span class="line"><!----> is related to this problem.<!----></span><br>Received signal 11 SEGV_ACCERR 7d8bfff8000a<span class="line"><!---->Received signal 11 SEGV_ACCERR Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <span class="line"><!---->) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you!           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1365101#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Sep 22, 2022, 9:15 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam FoundIn-107 Type-Bug-Regression
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam FoundIn-107 Type-Bug-Regression
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I believe this is not a security bug: we're erroneously reading a field out of the `undefined` sentinel and reinterpret that as a pointer (which crashes on the next step because it isn't a valid pointer), so the crashing address is not attacker-controlled. So I don't think this is exploitable, I think it'll always just crash. Besides, it needs user interaction (opening DevTools and inspecting something).<span class="line"><!---->I believe this is not a security bug: we're erroneously reading a field out of the `undefined` sentinel and reinterpret that as a pointer (which crashes on the next step because it isn't a valid pointer), so the crashing address is not attacker-controlled. So I don't think this is exploitable, I think it'll always just crash. Besides, it needs user interaction (opening DevTools and inspecting something).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
